snippet: On a hammock-shaped island in Florida, gatherers delight in the shells that pour onto the beach in piles, in part because of the area’s unique geography.
abstract: Sanibel Island and its neighbor Captiva Island, off Florida's southwest coast, are where beachcombers come for a seashell bonanza; on some days, shells pour onto the beach in piles, in part because of the area's unique geography.
lead_paragraph: On a hammock-shaped island in Florida, gatherers delight in the shells that pour onto the beach in piles, in part because of the area’s unique geography.

headline.seo: Sanibel Island Draws Seashells and Their Hunters
headline.main: A Florida Island Draws an Array of Seashells and Their Hunters
headline.print_headline: A Florida Island Draws An Array of Seashells And Their Hunters
